field.label: Enabled
field.help: Enable this Public Service.

field.label: Name
field.help: Name to identify this Public Service.

field.label: Description
field.help: Description for this Public Service.

field.label: Listen Addresses
field.help: Configure listen addresses for this Public Service, i.e. 127.0.0.1:8080 or www.example.com:443 or unix@socket-name. Use TAB key to complete typing a listen address.
field.hint: Enter address:port here. Finish with TAB.

field.label: Bind option pass-through
field.help:
A list of parameters that will be appended to every Listen Address line.
Example: accept-proxy npn http/1.1

field.label: Type
field.help: Set the running mode or protocol for this Public Service.

field.label: Default Backend Pool
field.help: Set the default Backend Pool to use for this Public Service.

field.label: Enable SSL offloading
field.help: Enable SSL offloading

field.label: Certificates
field.help:
Select certificates to use for SSL offloading. HAProxy's SNI recognition will determine the correct certificate automatically. If no SNI is provided by the client then the first certificate will be presented.
To import additional certificates, go to Certificate Manager.
field.hint: Type certificate name or choose from list.

field.label: Default certificate
field.help: This certificate will be presented if no SNI is provided by the client or if the client provides an SNI hostname which does not match any certificate. This parameter is optional to enforce a certain sort order for certificates.

field.label: SSL option pass-through
field.help: Pass additional SSL parameters to the HAProxy configuration.

field.label: Enable Advanced settings
field.help: Enable advanced SSL settings.

field.label: Minimum SSL Version
field.help: This option enforces use of the specified version (or higher) on SSL connections.

field.label: Maximum SSL Version
field.help: This option enforces use of the specified version (or lower) on SSL connections.

field.label: Cipher List
field.help: It sets the default string describing the list of cipher algorithms ("cipher suite") that are negotiated during the SSL/TLS handshake up to TLSv1.2.

field.label: Cipher Suites
field.help: It sets the default string describing the list of cipher algorithms ("cipher suite") that are negotiated during the SSL/TLS handshake for TLSv1.3.

field.label: Enable HSTS
field.help: Enable HTTP Strict Transport Security.

field.label: HSTS includeSubDomains
field.help: Enable if all present and future subdomains will be HTTPS.

field.label: HSTS preload
field.help: Enable if you like this domain to be included in the HSTS preload list.

field.label: HSTS max-age
field.help: Future requests to the domain should use only HTTPS for the specified time (in seconds): 15768000 = 6 months

field.label: Bind options
field.help: Used to enforce or disable certain SSL options.

field.label: Enable
field.help: Enable Client Certificate Authentication.

field.label: Verification
field.help: If set to 'optional' or 'required', client certificate is requested.

field.label: Certificate Authorities
field.help:
Select CA certificates to use for client certificate authentication.
To import additional CAs, go to CA Manager.
field.hint: Type CA name or choose from list.

field.label: Certificate Revocation Lists
field.help:
Select CRLs to use for client certificate authentication.
To import additional CRLs, go to CRL Manager.
field.hint: Type CRL name or choose from list.

field.label: Enable HTTP/2
field.help: Enable support for HTTP/2.

field.label: HTTP/2 without TLS
field.help: Enable support for HTTP/2 even if TLS (SSL offloading) is not enabled.

field.label: Advertise Protocols (ALPN)
field.help: When using the TLS ALPN extension, HAProxy advertises the specified protocol list as supported on top of ALPN. SSL offloading must be enabled.

field.label: X-Forwarded-For (DEPRECATED)
field.help: This option is DEPRECATED and should no longer be used. A new option is available in backend pool settings.

field.label: Prometheus Enabled
field.help: Enable HAProxy's Prometheus exporter.

field.label: Prometheus Path
field.help: The path where the Prometheus exporter can be accessed.

field.label: Connection Mode
field.help: By default HAProxy operates in keep-alive mode with regards to persistent connections. Option "httpclose" configures HAProxy to close connections with the server and the client as soon as the request and the response are received. It will also check if a "Connection: close" header is already set in each direction, and will add one if missing. Option "http-server-close" enables HTTP connection-close mode on the server side while keeping the ability to support HTTP keep-alive and pipelining on the client side.

field.label: Enable
field.help: Enable HTTP Basic Authentication.

field.label: Allowed Users
field.hint: Type username or choose from list.

field.label: Allowed Groups
field.hint: Type group or choose from list.

field.label: Maximum Connections
field.help: Set the maximum number of concurrent connections for this Public Service.

field.label: Client Timeout
field.help: Set the maximum inactivity time on the client side. Defaults to milliseconds. Optionally the unit may be specified as either "d", "h", "m", "s", "ms" or "us".

field.label: HTTP Request Timeout
field.help: Set the maximum allowed time to wait for a complete HTTP request. In order to offer DoS protection, it may be required to lower the maximum accepted time to receive a complete HTTP request without affecting the client timeout. This helps protecting against established connections on which nothing is sent. Defaults to milliseconds. Optionally the unit may be specified as either "d", "h", "m", "s", "ms" or "us".

field.label: HTTP Keep-Alive Timeout
field.help: Set the maximum allowed time to wait for a new HTTP request to appear. Defaults to milliseconds. Optionally the unit may be specified as either "d", "h", "m", "s", "ms" or "us".

field.label: CPU Affinity Rules
field.help: Choose CPU affinity rules that should be applied to this Public Service.

field.label: Shards
field.help: This option automatically creates the specified number of listeners for every IP:port combination and evenly distributes them among available threads. This can sometimes be useful when using very large thread counts where the in-kernel locking on a single socket starts to cause a significant overhead.

field.label: Don't log null
field.help: Enable or disable logging of connections with no data.

field.label: Don't log normal
field.help: Enable or disable logging of normal, successful connections.

field.label: Raise Log Level
field.help: Allow HAProxy to automatically raise log level for non-completely successful connections to aid debugging.

field.label: Detailed Logging
field.help: Enable or disable verbose logging. Each log line turns into a much richer format.

field.label: Separate Statistics
field.help: Enable or disable collecting & providing separate statistics for each socket.

field.label: Table type
field.help: Choose the type of data that should be stored in this stick-table. Note that this stick-table cannot be used for session persistence, it is only used to store additional per-connection data (select below). See the HAProxy documentation for further information.

field.label: Stored data types
field.help: This is used to store additional information in the stick-table. It may be used by ACLs in order to control various criteria related to the activity of the client matching the stick-table. Note that this directly impacts memory usage. See the HAProxy documentation for a full description.

field.label: Expiration time
field.help: Enter a number followed by one of the supported suffixes "d" (days), "h" (hour), "m" (minute), "s" (seconds), "ms" (miliseconds). This configures the maximum duration of an entry in the stick-table since it was last created, refreshed or matched. The maximum duration is slightly above 24 days.

field.label: Size
field.help: Enter a number followed by one of the supported suffixes "k", "m", "g". This configures the maximum number of entries that can fit in the table. This value directly impacts memory usage. Count approximately 50 bytes per entry, plus the size of a string if any.

field.label: Enable sticky counters
field.help: Enable to be able to retrieve values from sticky counters. If disabled, all values will return 0, rendering many conditions useless.

field.label: Sticky counter key
field.help: It describes what elements of the incoming request or connection will be analyzed, extracted, combined, and used to select which table entry to update the counters. Defaults to "src" to track elements of the source IP. See the HAProxy documentation for a full description.

field.label: Max. data length
field.help: Specify the maximum length for a value in the stick-table. If the value is larger than this value it will be truncated before being stored. Depending on the stick-table type this repesents either characters or bytes.

field.label: Connection rate period
field.help: The length of the period over which the average is measured. It reports the average incoming connection rate over that period, in connections per period. Defaults to milliseconds. Optionally the unit may be specified as either "d", "h", "m", "s", "ms" or "us".

field.label: Session rate period
field.help: The length of the period over which the average is measured. It reports the average incoming session rate over that period, in sessions per period. Defaults to milliseconds. Optionally the unit may be specified as either "d", "h", "m", "s", "ms" or "us".

field.label: HTTP request rate period
field.help: The length of the period over which the average is measured. It reports the average HTTP request rate over that period, in requests per period. Defaults to milliseconds. Optionally the unit may be specified as either "d", "h", "m", "s", "ms" or "us".

field.label: HTTP error rate period
field.help: The length of the period over which the average is measured. It reports the average HTTP request error rate over that period, in requests per period. Defaults to milliseconds. Optionally the unit may be specified as either "d", "h", "m", "s", "ms" or "us".

field.label: Bytes in rate period
field.help: The length of the period over which the average is measured. It reports the average incoming bytes rate over that period, in bytes per period. Defaults to milliseconds. Optionally the unit may be specified as either "d", "h", "m", "s", "ms" or "us".

field.label: Bytes out rate period
field.help: The length of the period over which the average is measured. It reports the average outgoing bytes rate over that period, in bytes per period. Defaults to milliseconds. Optionally the unit may be specified as either "d", "h", "m", "s", "ms" or "us".

field.label: Option pass-through
field.help: These lines will be added to the HAProxy frontend configuration.

field.label: Select Rules
field.help: Choose rules to be included in this Public Service.

field.label: Select Error Messages
field.help: Choose error messages to be included in this Public Service.
